content: Hi, Sally. Warmest greetings from the (admittedly small) Irish contingent. I hope you enjoy yourself on the site. It's sad to say, but most of the folks here haven't had the privilege of serving in a proper army (the British Army), but don't hold that against them. MsG PS: don't lend Greywolfghost any money and don't believe any tall tales from Outlay.

content: WHAT!?!? I served with both Brits and Canadians, and have the Beret with Tanker Crest and snazzy belt with the weird interlocking shiny buckle with the Crown in the middle to prove it!! 'Course I had to trade my field jacket, ammo belt and Boonie Hat to get 'em, and then the Beret was too small!! (Give me yer dough! and an Ale) My suggestion to Sally would be to introduce herself a little further and fill out her bio a little better - - Oh, bugsy, me people date back to 1600 Kilenny (Ormonde) Wandering and Wondering

content: Welcome to the best blogs in the world! They happen right here on the many other forums though out military.com Step one is for you to be sure that you have read reasonably understand the Terms of Service. You can find that located at the bottom of this page. Step two would be read the rules and comments at the top of each forum. They will be in bold print. Step three would be for you visit several different forms, read the posts and see which ones you would like to start with. Step three would be to pick a topic and jump in. Remember play nice. Blessings to you and yours, Bruce OAL God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans
